meanings.definition: To insert (a shoot or bud) into another plant.
meanings.sent1: She carefully grafted a new branch onto the tree.
meanings.sent2: The gardener grafted a rose cutting onto the rootstock.
meanings.sent3: The tree felt proud to have a new branch grafted onto it.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was grafted like a strong branch onto a sturdy tree.
meanings.sent5: The idea grafted itself into her mind, growing stronger each day.

meanings.sent1: The two pieces of wood were grafted together seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: The families grafted together through marriage.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces grafted together perfectly, forming a complete picture.
meanings.sent4: Their hearts grafted as one, beating in harmony.
meanings.sent5: Their destinies grafted together, intertwined forever.
